subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private methods in a class.
msgSnippet: ... Avoiding duplication of setup is the whole point of fixtures. You hardly need to expose your private methods to avoid duplicating setup code. --
messageBody:
Robert wrote:

> Thirdly: if it's not tested enough, then exposing the method and
> writing new tests is not duplication - in fact, it can significantly
> reduce duplication by removing the need to duplicate extraneous setup
> work.

Avoiding duplication of setup is the whole point of fixtures. You hardly
need to expose your private methods to avoid duplicating setup code.

--
